connection.path_tooltip: Here you need to select the CK3 folder where your user data are stored, not where the game files are! By default it stored in your user documents, inside the Paradox interactive folder
connection.connection_valid_warning: Connection valid! Warning: context size couldn't be detected, overwrite context size will be used! (even if disabled!)

actions.use_same_api: Use the same API as in the connection tab
actions.select_actions: Select which actions you want the mod to detect:

summarization.use_same_api: Use the same API as in the connection tab

prompts.suffix_tooltip: If enabled, suffix prompt is inserted as the last (system) message before sending the API request, it's useful for jailbreaking, or instructing the model on how to format the response message.
prompts.narrative_tooltip: This prompt is used to generate AI narrative descriptions after actions are triggered. The narrative provides atmospheric descriptions of events in the game.
prompts.scene_description_tooltip: This prompt is used to generate the initial scene description at the start of conversation. It provides background and atmosphere for character interactions.
prompts.restore_tooltip: Click this button to restore all prompts to their default values
prompts.scripts_tooltip: Some prompts are too advanced to be made up by static texts, they require script files that dynamically writes the prompts based on the ingame variables.
prompts.char_desc_script_tooltip: Select the script that generates character descriptions. Standard scripts are provided by the mod, custom scripts can be added by the user.
prompts.ex_msg_script_tooltip: Select the script that provides example messages for the AI. This helps the AI understand the desired tone and format.
prompts.bookmarks_tooltip: Select the bookmark script to use for processing game events into summaries.

settings.clean_tooltip: The mod will try to remove parts of the messages that the llm shouldn't have generated, like emojis
settings.shuffle_tooltip: Randomize the order in which characters generate messages in multi-character conversations. Note: If enabled, the speaking order of each character will be random, which may lead to confusion in the LLM's output character identity.
settings.dynamic_tooltip: Use LLM to analyze conversation and select the next character to speak. The LLM will choose from a pool of characters who haven't spoken yet in the current round.
settings.validate_tooltip: When streaming is disabled and there are more than 2 characters, validate that the generated message matches the character's identity. If validation fails, regenerate up to 3 times.
settings.show_suggestions_tooltip: Show or hide the suggestions button in the chat window. Controls whether to display the recommended input statements feature.
settings.generate_scene_tooltip: Generate scene description at the start of conversation to provide context and background for characters.
settings.auto_suggestions_tooltip: When enabled, suggestions will be automatically generated at the start of conversation and after each round of dialogue.
settings.auto_send_tooltip: When enabled, selecting a suggestion will automatically send the message without clicking the send button.

system.check_on_startup_desc: VOTC - Community Edition will automatically check for new versions when the application starts.
system.early_access_desc: VOTC - Community Edition will automatically be updated to pre-release versions as well.
system.logs_desc: If you experience errors/crashes, send the logs to our discord server
system.clear_summaries_desc: This will delete the summaries of previous conversations of all characters

chat.undo_tooltip: Remove the last exchange (your message and the AI's response).
chat.leave_tooltip: End the current conversation and save the summary.

summary_manager.delete_confirm: Are you sure you want to delete this summary?
summary_manager.select_first: Please select a summary to update first

readme.subtitle: CK3 AI Conversation Mod
readme.step1_1: Click on the 'Connection' option in the left menu
readme.step1_2: Select your text generation API provider (e.g., OpenAI, Kobold, etc.)
readme.step1_3: Enter your API key and related configurations
readme.step1_4: Set the CK3 user folder path (usually located in 'Documents/Paradox Interactive/Crusader Kings III')
readme.step2_3: Right-click on any character in the game
readme.step3_desc: When you initiate a conversation in the game, Voices of the Court will automatically pop up a chat window where you can:
readme.step3_2: Influence game state and character relationships
readme.step3_3: Experience dynamically generated character personality traits
readme.warning_desc: Before first use, please ensure that the Voices of the Court - Community Edition mod is enabled in the game and correctly installed according to the mod instructions.
readme.feat1_desc: Engage in intelligent dialogue with any character in the game. The AI generates appropriate responses based on the character's personality, traits, and current context.
readme.feat2_desc: The AI dynamically generates unique personality traits and dialogue styles based on the character's traits, skills, and relationships.
readme.feat3_desc: Automatically generate summaries for long conversations to maintain context and avoid token limit issues.
readme.feat4_desc: Detect various actions in the game (such as opinion changes, giving money, etc.) and generate corresponding AI narratives.
readme.feat5_desc: Import specific playbooks to fill the game world view and character summaries.
readme.adv_feat1: Multi-character Dialogue: Support for conversing with multiple characters simultaneously
readme.adv_feat2: Character Validation: Ensure AI-generated responses match character identity
readme.adv_feat3: Dynamic Character Selection: AI intelligently selects the next character to respond
readme.adv_feat4: Custom Prompts: Fully customize AI behavior and response styles
readme.adv_feat5: Conversation History Management: View and manage all conversation records
readme.conf_conn_desc: Configure the connection with the language model API and game path settings.
readme.conf_conn_api1: API Provider: Select text generation API (OpenAI, KoboldAI, Text Generation WebUI, OobaBooga, Player2, etc.)
readme.conf_conn_api2: API Key: Enter the API key for the selected service
readme.conf_conn_api3: Endpoint URL: The URL address of the API service
readme.conf_conn_api4: Model Name: Select the specific model to use
readme.conf_conn_path1: Path Setting: Set the CK3 folder path where user data is stored
readme.conf_conn_path2: Default Path: Documents/Paradox Interactive/Crusader Kings III
readme.conf_conn_path3: Selection Method: Browse and select the correct path via the 'Select Folder' button
readme.conf_act_desc: Configure detectable actions in the game and corresponding AI responses.
readme.conf_act_enable1: Master Switch: Controls whether to enable the action detection feature
readme.conf_act_enable2: Enable AI Narrative: Generate AI narrative descriptions after actions are triggered
readme.conf_act_api1: Same Settings: Use the same API configuration as the Connection page
readme.conf_act_api2: Independent Configuration: Configure API settings separately for the action feature
readme.conf_act_param1: Temperature: Controls the creativity of AI responses (default 0.2, lower values make responses more deterministic)
readme.conf_act_param2: Frequency Penalty: Reduces the generation of repetitive content
readme.conf_act_param3: Presence Penalty: Encourages talking about new topics
readme.conf_act_param4: Top P: Controls the diversity of vocabulary selection
readme.conf_act_sel1: Action List: Select the types of actions you want the mod to detect from the list
readme.conf_act_sel2: Action Info: Each action has a description and creator information
readme.conf_act_sel3: Reload Files: Button to refresh the action list
readme.conf_act_sel4: Open Folder: Button to access custom action scripts
readme.conf_sum_desc: Configure API settings for the conversation summary feature.
readme.conf_sum_api1: Same Settings: Use the same API configuration as the Connection page
readme.conf_sum_api2: Independent Configuration: Configure API settings separately for the summary feature
readme.conf_sum_param1: Temperature: Controls the creativity of summaries (default 0.2)
readme.conf_sum_param2: Frequency Penalty: Reduces repetitive content in summaries
readme.conf_sum_param3: Presence Penalty: Encourages including new information
readme.conf_sum_param4: Top P: Controls the diversity of vocabulary selection
readme.conf_sum_info_desc: The summary feature is used to compress long conversations into short summaries, helping to keep the conversation context within token limits and generating summaries for future conversations after the dialogue ends.
readme.conf_prom_desc: Configure various prompts and scripts for interacting with the AI.
readme.conf_prom_main1: Main Prompt: Basic instructions controlling how the AI responds
readme.conf_prom_main2: Self-Talk Prompt: Generation rules for character inner monologues
readme.conf_prom_main3: Summarize Prompt: Instructions for generating conversation summaries
readme.conf_prom_main4: Self-Talk Summarize Prompt: Summary rules for character inner monologues
readme.conf_prom_main5: Memories Prompt: How characters remember and reference past events
readme.conf_prom_main6: Suffix Prompt: The last system message inserted before the API request to guide model response formatting
readme.conf_prom_main7: Narrative Prompt: Rules for generating AI narrative descriptions after actions are triggered
readme.conf_prom_script1: Character Description Script: Script for dynamically generating character descriptions
readme.conf_prom_script2: Example Messages Script: Script for generating example conversation messages
readme.conf_prom_script3: Playbook: Specific playbook files used for importing, containing world view and character settings
readme.conf_prom_ver1: Standard Version: Default scripts provided by the application
readme.conf_prom_ver2: Custom Version: Scripts created or modified by the user
readme.conf_prom_ver3: Dropdown Selection: Select the script version to use via the dropdown menu
readme.conf_prom_ver4: Open Folder: Button to access script files
readme.conf_sett_desc: Contains various behavior and generation parameter configurations for the application.
readme.conf_sett_basic1: Max New Tokens: Limits the maximum length of a single AI response
readme.conf_sett_basic2: Max Memory Tokens: Limits the maximum length of character memories
readme.conf_sett_basic3: Stream Messages: Enable/disable streaming responses (real-time display of AI generation process)
readme.conf_sett_basic4: Clean Messages: Attempt to remove unwanted content from AI generation (e.g., emojis)
readme.conf_sett_basic5: Shuffle Character Order: Randomize character speaking order in multi-person conversations
readme.conf_sett_basic6: Dynamic Character Selection: Use LLM to analyze conversation and select the next character to speak
readme.conf_sett_basic7: Validate Character Identity: Verify that generated messages match character identity to prevent LLM from generating other characters' replies
readme.conf_sett_basic8: Show Suggestions Button: Show/hide the recommended input statements feature in the chat window
readme.conf_sett_depth1: Summary Insertion Depth: Controls the insertion position of summaries in conversation history
readme.conf_sett_depth2: Memory Insertion Depth: Controls the insertion position of character memories in conversation history
readme.conf_sett_depth3: Character Description Insertion Depth: Controls the insertion position of character descriptions in conversation history
readme.conf_sett_instr1: Input Sequence: Special markers for user input
readme.conf_sett_instr2: Output Sequence: Special markers for AI output
readme.conf_sett_param1: Temperature: Controls the creativity of AI responses (default 0.8)
readme.conf_sett_param2: Frequency Penalty: Reduces the generation of repetitive content
readme.conf_sett_param3: Presence Penalty: Encourages talking about new topics
readme.conf_sett_param4: Top P: Controls the diversity of vocabulary selection (default 0.9)
readme.conf_sys_desc: Provides application maintenance and community link features.
readme.conf_sys_upd1: Current Version: Displays the current application version
readme.conf_sys_upd2: Check for Updates: Button to manually check for new versions
readme.conf_sys_upd3: Check for Updates on Startup: Option to automatically check for updates when the app starts
readme.conf_sys_log1: Error Viewing: View log files if you experience errors/crashes
readme.conf_sys_log2: Open Logs Folder: Button to directly access log files
readme.conf_sys_sum1: Clear Summaries: Button to delete previous conversation summaries for all characters
readme.conf_sys_sum2: Open Conversation Summaries Folder: Button to access stored conversation summaries
readme.conf_tune_key1: Temperature: Controls AI creativity; 0.1-0.3 for deterministic responses, 0.7-1.0 for creative dialogue
readme.conf_tune_key2: Top P: Controls vocabulary diversity; recommended value 0.9
readme.conf_tune_key3: Frequency Penalty: Reduces repetitive content; recommended value 0.1-0.5
readme.conf_tune_key4: Presence Penalty: Encourages new topics; recommended value 0.1-0.5
readme.conf_tune_key5: Max Tokens: Controls single response length; adjust based on model
readme.conf_tune_scene1: Serious Roleplay: Temperature 0.2-0.4, Frequency Penalty 0.3, Presence Penalty 0.2
readme.conf_tune_scene2: Creative Dialogue: Temperature 0.7-0.9, Frequency Penalty 0.1, Presence Penalty 0.1
readme.conf_tune_scene3: Historical Simulation: Temperature 0.3-0.5, Frequency Penalty 0.2, Presence Penalty 0.3
readme.chat_feat_desc: The chat interface is the primary interface for interacting with game characters.
readme.chat_feat_msg1: Message Styles: Player and AI character messages are displayed in different styles
readme.chat_feat_msg2: Format Support: Supports basic Markdown formatting (bold, italic)
readme.chat_feat_msg3: Narrative Messages: Narrative messages are displayed in a special style, providing scene descriptions
readme.chat_feat_inp1: Text Input: Enter dialogue content with characters
readme.chat_feat_inp2: Sending Method: Enter key to send messages
readme.chat_feat_sug1: Suggestion Button: Displays recommended input statements
readme.chat_feat_sug2: Suggestion List: Click a suggestion to automatically fill the input box
readme.chat_feat_sug3: Close Button: Hides the suggestion panel
readme.chat_feat_ctrl1: End Conversation: Button to exit the current dialogue
readme.chat_feat_stat1: Loading Indicator: Shows AI is generating a response
readme.chat_feat_stat2: Error Messages: Displays connection or generation errors
readme.sum_feat_desc: Interface for managing and editing game character conversation summaries.
readme.sum_feat_btn1: Refresh Button: Reloads all summary data, including parsing player ID from game logs and reading summary files
readme.sum_feat_btn2: Save Button: Saves all current summary changes to file
readme.sum_feat_btn3: Close Button: Closes the Summary Manager window
readme.sum_feat_info1: Player ID: Displays the current player ID parsed from game logs (read-only)
readme.sum_feat_info2: Select Character: Dropdown menu to filter summaries for a specific character or view all
readme.sum_feat_info3: Summary File Path: Displays the storage path of the current summary file (read-only)
readme.sum_feat_list1: Summary List: Displays all summaries under current filters, each containing date, character, and content
readme.sum_feat_list2: Add New Summary: Creates a new blank summary at the top of the list, defaulting to the selected character
readme.sum_feat_edit1: Date Input: Edit the date of the currently selected summary
readme.sum_feat_edit2: Content Textbox: Edit the detailed content of the currently selected summary
readme.sum_feat_edit3: Update Summary: Button to save changes to the currently selected summary
readme.sum_feat_edit4: Delete Summary: Button to delete the currently selected summary (requires confirmation)
readme.sum_feat_edit5: New Summary: Button to clear the editor and prepare for a new summary
readme.sum_feat_use1: Select Summary: Click a summary in the list to select and load it into the editor
readme.sum_feat_use2: Character Filter: Use the character filter to view summaries for a specific character or all characters
readme.sum_feat_use3: Save Changes: All changes must be saved by clicking the 'Save' button to be written to file
readme.sum_feat_use4: Deletion Note: Deletion cannot be undone, please use with caution
readme.about_title: Voices of the Court - Community Edition
readme.about_desc: A revolutionary mod for Crusader Kings III that integrates Large Language Models into the game, allowing players to converse with game characters. Original author: Durond.
readme.link1_desc: Complete usage guide and API documentation
readme.link2_desc: View the mod on Steam Workshop (Legacy version)
readme.link3_desc: View source code and submit issues
readme.about_thanks_desc: Thanks to all contributors and community members for their support in keeping this project growing.
readme.prob1_q: Q: Application cannot connect to AI service
readme.prob1_a1: Confirm if the API key is correct
readme.prob1_a2: Check if the network connection is normal
readme.prob1_a3: Verify if the API endpoint URL is correct
readme.prob1_a4: Check detailed error messages in system logs
readme.prob1_a5: Check if parameters like Temperature and Top P are set reasonably; try resetting to defaults if adjusted
readme.prob2_q: Q: Conversation options are not showing in game
readme.prob2_a1: The latest version of Voices of the Court mod is correctly installed and enabled
readme.prob2_a2: CK3 user folder path is set correctly
readme.prob2_a3: Game version is compatible with the mod version
readme.prob2_a4: Restart both the game and the application
readme.prob3_q: Q: AI responses do not match the character
readme.prob3_a2: Lower the temperature parameter to make responses more deterministic
readme.prob3_a4: Check if the character description script is loaded correctly
readme.prob4_a1: View log files in the System page
readme.prob4_a2: Confirm if the API service has request limits
readme.prob4_a3: Check if conversation history exceeds token limits
readme.help_desc: If the above methods cannot solve the problem:
readme.help1: Check log files in the System page for detailed information
readme.help2: Submit a bug report on GitHub

dialog.no_updates_message: You are running the latest version.
dialog.dev_updates_message: Updates are disabled in development mode.
dialog.early_access_detail: A new Early Access version is available. Would you like to update now?
dialog.stable_detail: A new stable version is available. Would you like to update now?
dialog.update_failed_message: Could not connect to GitHub to check for updates.
dialog.clear_summaries_message: Are you sure you want to clear conversation summaries?
dialog.announcement_message:
We have a new Discord server and a new Steam mod!

Discord: Join our community for support and discussion.
Steam: Check out 'Voices of the Court - Community Edition' on the Steam Workshop.

tray.tooltip: Voices of the Court - Community Edition CK3 mod

history.select_file: Please select a conversation file from the list to view content
history.load_fail: Failed to load conversation history data:
history.no_player_id: Unable to parse player ID from game logs
